titleproper.value: Preliminary Inventory to the Jane Churchma Squatters' Rights Collection  <num>TAM 313</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-05-15T18:00:41</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

p.value: Donated by Jane Churchman in 2006. The accession number associated with this gift is 2006.012.
Jane Churchman was a squatter and housing rights activist in New York City.

The squatters' rights movement which was centered in New York City's East Village and Lower East Side reached its peak in the late 1980s and culminated in the Tompkins Square Park Police Riot of August 1988. However, the movement continued well into the 1990s. The collection consists of clippings and subject files related to housing and New York City politics that were accumulated by squatter Jane Churchman.

subject.value: Tompkins Square Park Riot, New York, N.Y., 1988.
